globalAttributes.name: :if
globalAttributes.description: Use the `:if` attribute to conditionally render a block. The block will only be rendered if the given expression returns a truthy value.

globalAttributes.name: :else
globalAttributes.description: Use `:else` to indicate an “else block” for `:if`.

globalAttributes.name: :else-if
globalAttributes.description: The `:else-if` serves as an “else if block” for `:if`. It can be chained multiple times.

globalAttributes.name: :for
globalAttributes.description: Nue uses `:for` attribute to render over arrays, objects, and components. Nue has a somewhat simpler syntax for loops than Vue. For example, you don’t need to maintain a loop state with a special “key” variable.

globalAttributes.name: :bind
globalAttributes.description: The bind attribute makes the item properties accessible directly on the component. So instead of `{ item.title }` you can write `{ title }` inside the component.

globalAttributes.name: :class
globalAttributes.description: Nue supports a special object notation to help render the class attribute.

globalAttributes.name: :attr
globalAttributes.description: Attr directive renders a DOM attribute for each property in an object.

globalAttributes.name: ref
globalAttributes.description: name a DOM node with `ref` attribute.
